intro: Stylidium longitubum, commonly known as the long-tubed stylidium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange. The plant has a compact growth habit with linear leaves and produces showy, nectar-rich blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
